name: fosetyl-Al production | sodium nitrate | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/25824/documentation

This dataset represents the production of fosetyl-Al (1 kg of active ingredient). Raw materials are modelled with a stoichiometric calculation. Energy consumption is modelled with data from a similar process. The emissions are estimated. Infrastructure is included with a default value.

From reception of precursors (aluminium hydroxide, ethanol, hydrochloric acid, nitric acid, phosphoric acid, phosphorous chloride, sodium hydroxide, and water decarbonised) at the factory gate.

This activity ends with fosetyl-Al at the factory gate. The dataset includes the input materials, energy uses, infrastructure and emissions. The dataset doesn't include emulsives, additives etc.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/202:Manufacture of other chemical products/2021:Manufacture of pesticides and other agrochemical products

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The inventory is modelled for Europe.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Fosetyl-Al is a pesticide produced in four steps from phosphorus trichloride, each reaction has an estimated efficiancy of 95%:;PCl3 + 2 C2H6O + H2O → C4H11O3P + 3 HCl ;C4H11O3P + H3PO3 → 2 C2H7O3P ;C2H7O3P + C2H5ONa → C2H6O3PNa + C2H6O ;3 C2H6O3PNa + Al(NO3)3 → C6H18AlO9P3 + 3 NaNO3 ;Precursor used for the fosetyl-Al production is aluminium nitrate (Al(NO3)3). Aluminium nitrate (Al(NO3)3) is produced from aluminium hydroxide and nitric acid: ;Al(OH)3 + 3 HNO3 → Al(NO3)3 + 3 H2O;The formed aluminium nitrate is a valuable by-product. The formed HCl is neutralised and disposed.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Literature data and stoichiometric calculation. This inventory is partially based on a generic model of the production of chemicals. The data generated by this model have been improved with compound-specific data when available.

exchanges.description: Calculated value based on stoichiometric calculations and literature data. For more information on the calculations refer to the sampling procedure.

exchanges.description: Estimation, assuming a default value, originated from calculation of avarage consumption of electricity and heat per kg of product (3.2 MJ kg-1), and a resulting amount of heat of 2 MJ for every reaction step per kg reaction product, considering that the demand is made up of a mix that inlcudes 12% steam from external energy sources. Additionally, reaction steps are approximated with energy consumption data, assuming that inventory flows can be estimated using process data for basic operation steps, available for specific organic chemicals. Further references: Kim S., Overcash M.: Energy in chemical manufacturing processes: gate-to-gate information for life cycle assessment. In: Journal of Chemical Technology & Biotechnology vol. 78, no. 9: 995-1005(11). 2003
